mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter from Jennie Howard to Dr. Thomas H. Howard Postmarked Jan. 3rd, 1868
mdRecord.dcterms:description: A letter from Jennie Howard, postmarked Jan. 3rd, 1868, relays that her daughter is doing much better after being sick. She shares that there were many Christmas parties and "marrying is all the rage." She shares that the tenants on her farm caused the Gin House, and Gin Thrasher to burn down. In the last paragraph she touches on labor issues, writing, "it is getting to be quite a difficult matter to hire cooks down here. We will all have to learn to do our own work.
